questions.question_text:
A custom object has a Public Read Only sharing setting that does not grant access using hierarchies. A dynamic sharing rule provides Write access to the object to the Global Marketing public group if the record is marked as Global. A user creates a new record and marks it as Global.
Who will have write access to the record?

discussion.content:
B is correct. Because: 
1. The object is PUBLIC READ ONLY - Everyone see it but doesn't not write 
2. "Does not grant access using hierarchies" - managers cannot necessarily write on records. 
3. Global marketing public group can write all records marked Global - record type allow them to write through the dynamic sharing rule.
Never mind "does not grant access using hierarchies." That is why it is not D.
Can anyone tell me why the answer is not D?

choices.D: The Global Marketing public group, the record owner, and anyone above the owner in the role hierarchy.
choices.B: The record owner and the Global Marketing public group.
choices.C: The record owner and anyone above the owner in the role hierarchy.
choices.A: The Global Marketing public group and anyone above the owner in the role hierarchy.
